intro: Taraxacum semireductum, commonly known as the semi-reduced dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and a yellow composite flower head that develops into a fluffy seed head. This plant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. It has a taproot system and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. The plant is also notable for its medicinal properties, though it is less commonly used than other dandelion species.
